thread.title: Ryanair says it is the first airline to fly over 10 million passengers in one month
thread.title_full: Ryanair says it is the first airline to fly over 10 million passengers in one month

title: Ryanair says it is the first airline to fly over 10 million passengers in one month
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Wed, Aug 5, 2015, 11:38 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 52 mins Ryanair says it is the first airline to fly over 10 million passengers in one month By Ben Martin | Telegraph – 16 minutes ago 1,708.00 +22.0000 
The low-cost airline claimed it has broken a record and flown more customers than any other carrier 
Low-cost carrier Ryanair said it flew more than 10 million international passengers last month, a feat it claimed was a first for any airline. 
Traffic rose by 11pc to a record 10.14 million customers in July, compared with the same month a year earlier, the Dublin-based airline disclosed on Wednesday. 
Ryanair's load factor - a key measure indicating how many seats flown were actually occupied - increased by 4 percentage points to 95pc. 
"This is the first time ever that any airline has carried over 10 million international customers in one calendar month," said Kenny Jacobs, of Ryanair. 
Ryanair boss Michael O'Leary 
The budget airline, which is led by outspoken chief executive Michael O'Leary, used its latest traffic figures to take a swipe at Aer Lingus (Other OTC: AELGF - news ) , which it failed to buy three times . 
Ireland (Other OTC: IRLD - news ) 's flag carrier is now being acquired by British Airways-owner International Airlines Group, which is helmed by Mr O'Leary's fierce rival Willie Walsh. 
"We carried more customers in one month (10.14 million in July) than Aer Lingus carried in a whole year (9.77 million in 2014)," Mr Jacobs said. 
He added that the growth in passenger numbers was partly down to Ryanair's efforts to revamp its image and improve customer service , an initiative it has called its "Always Getting Better" campaign. 
"These record customer numbers and highest ever load factors are due to our lower fares, our stronger forward bookings and the continuing success of our “Always Getting Better” customer experience programme, which continues to deliver stronger than expected traffic and load factors on our biggest ever summer schedule," Mr Jacobs said. 
Separately, Wizz Air (LSE: WIZZ.L - news ) , an Eastern Europe-focused no-frills carrier, also reported strong growth on Wednesday, with its passenger numbers surging by one-fifth to almost 2 mimllion in July. It posted a load factor of 92.7pc, up 1.1 percentage point.
